definition.text: South Korea is a sovereign presidential republic in East Asia located on the southern portion of the Korean Peninsula. Following the Korean War, it transitioned from a low-income agrarian economy to a high-income, export-oriented industrial and technological power. Its development model combined state-led industrial policy, chaebol-centered conglomerate growth, human capital accumulation, and deep integration into global value chains.
